Package com.yardi.ejb

Class UniqueTokensBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yardi.ejb.UniqueTokensBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UniqueTokens
    public class UniqueTokensBean
extends java.lang.Object
implements UniqueTokens
    Session Bean implementation of methods for working with user tokens.

        private Pwd_Policy pwdPolicy
        Reference to com.yardi.ejb.model.Pwd_Policy entity. Although com.yardi.ejb.UniqueTokensBean is stateless, Pwd_Policy is a singleton so it can be safely stored on the bean.

      • find

        public Unique_Tokens find​(long rrn)
        Find the Unique_Tokens entity by relative record number.

        Specified by:
        find in interface UniqueTokens
        Parameters:
        rrn - relative record number of the entity to find.
        Returns:
        Unique_Tokens entity matching the given relative record number. Returns null if the persistence context does not contain a Unique_Tokens entity for the given relative record number and the UNIQUE_TOKENS database table has no row matching the given relative record number.

      • findTokens

        public java.util.Vector<Unique_Tokens> findTokens​(java.lang.String userName)
        Find all the tokens for the given userName.

        The query result is ordered by date added (descending) and rrn (descending) because date 2020 (newer) > 2019 and on the same day rrn 7 (newer) > 3. Thus the returned Vector is ordered newest to oldest.

        Specified by:
        findTokens in interface UniqueTokens
        Parameters:
        userName - specifies which tokens will be found.
        Returns:
        Vector of Unique_Tokens entities matching the given userName. Returns an empty Vector if the persistence context contains no Unique_Token entities for the given userName and the UNIQUE_TOKENS database table has no rows for the given userName.

      • getPwdPolicy

        private Pwd_Policy getPwdPolicy()
        Returns a reference to the Pwd_Policy entity from com.yardi.ejb.PasswordPolicyBean.

        postConstructCallback() calls this method. On the initial call the pwdPolicy field is null so setPwdPolicy() is called to obtain a reference to password policy from com.yardi.ejb.PasswordPolicyBean.getPwdPolicy().

        Returns:
        reference to Pwd_Policy entity.

      • removeExtraTokens

        public java.util.Vector<Unique_Tokens> removeExtraTokens​(java.util.Vector<Unique_Tokens> userTokens)
        Remove Unique_Tokens entities when the number of stored tokens the user has exceeds the maximum defined in password policy.

        Field ppNbrUnique in the Pwd_Policy entity defines the maximum number of stored tokens a user can have in UNIQUE_TOKENS database table. If the number of stored tokens the user has exceeds this number, remove these extra tokens. This can happen if the maximum number of tokens to store, as defined in password policy, is changed.

        Specified by:
        removeExtraTokens in interface UniqueTokens
        Parameters:
        userTokens - Vector containing Unique_Tokens entities to remove.
        Returns:
        Vector containing, at most, the maximum number of stored tokens the user can have.

      • removeOldestToken

        public void removeOldestToken​(java.util.Vector<Unique_Tokens> userTokens)
        Remove the oldest stored token in token history so that the number of stored tokens in token history will not exceed the maximum defined in password policy when the new token is stored.

        When the user is changing their password, this is one of two times that tokens stored in UNIQUE_TOKENS database table are removed.

        First, if the user has more stored tokens in UNIQUE_TOKENS than the maximum defined in password policy, then remove these extra tokens. See removeExtraTokens().

        Second, this method will remove the oldest stored token so that when the next token is stored, the number of stored tokens the user has does not exceed the maximum number of stored tokens as defined in password policy.

        Field ppNbrUnique in the Pwd_Policy entity defines the maximum number of stored tokens a user can have.

        Specified by:
        removeOldestToken in interface UniqueTokens
        Parameters:
        userTokens - Vector containing Unique_Token entities to remove.

      • setPwdPolicy

        private void setPwdPolicy()
        Set Pwd_Policy entity to the reference obtained from com.yardi.ejb.PasswordPoilcyBean

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        1
